title: I can't figure out which profile and email folders are correct and needed
creator: rbrook1
content:
I am looking to copy Thunderbird to a new machine but it's not as simple as it should be because I have Thunderbird data in multiple places. From Help/Troubleshooting Profiles, I get:

Default Profile yes Root Directory C:\Users\Randy\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\ohig3f3m.default Local Directory C:\Users\Randy\AppData\Local\Thunderbird\Profiles\ohig3f3m.default

The root directory is 1.37 Gb The local directory is 8.23 Mb I also have d:\data\thunderbird which is 14.7 Gb. There is no Profiles subfolder here.

The two profiles folders show ohig3f3m.default was updated today. All three folders show files as recent as today.

The file sizes shouldn't be surprising. I have saved emails back to 2007 and I'm a prolific email writer.

I'm guessing that some time years ago, with a much smaller main hard drive, there was an option to save Tbird data to a different location than the default. So I set it to be on my D drive.

So what do I do now? I could copy all three directories to a new machine in the same locations. I think that should work. But is there some way I could or should simplify things, or should I just leave well enough alone.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:137.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/137.0

title: Unable to Add Mail Accounts to Thunderbird
creator: graeme.hurst16
content: UNABLE TO RE-ADD MAIL ACCOUNTS TO THUNDERBIRD For the last three or four months I have been getting two separate messages in the bottom of the screen when opening Thunderbird on my laptop. "GMAIL settings are out of date" and "Yahoo settings are out of date". Then, a about a month ago when I opened Thunderbird I noticed that it was trying to download almost 3000 Gmail emails. I had always believed that only new Gmail messages would download on start up? Whilst this was happening it was impossiblle to do anything on my laptop as I had limited internet access. The only way I could see to stop this was to delete my Gmail account from Thunderbird. When I opened Thunderbird I continued to get the messages "settings are out of date" for each of my mail accounts. So I deleted my email accounts from Thunderbird with the intention of re-adding them. I then downloaded and re-installed Thunderbird to ensure I was on the latest version. I then tried to re-add my mail accounts, letting Thunderbird find and load the correct email settings for each account but I now get an error message saying "Unable to Log In at Server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password". Refer to attached screenshot. I can log in to my Mail Accounts OK using Firefox so I know my username and password are correct. I also tried adding my mail accounts manually in Thunderbird but I contiue to get the same message. I am unable to add my mail accounts to Thunderbird and I have run out of ideas regarding diagnosis and resolution. I need help please.

title: Thunderbird & Hotmail
creator: lilfeff
content:
Hi, I have just set-up 2 new Hotmail accounts & checked them both etc & both are working perfectly through Outlook. I also have 2 old/existing Hotmail accounts that too are working perfectly through both Outlook & Thunderbird. All accounts are set-up in Thunderbird using POP3 using OAuth2 authentification for both POP3 & SMTP servers. Unfortunately, I am having trouble adding both the 2 new Hotmail accounts to Thunderbird. When adding an account & inputting "Name", "Email Address" & "Password" & then enter I receive the message in a green bar stating "Configuration found in Mozilla ISP database"............brilliant !!! I then select the "POP3" button & hit the box "Done" Normally, all would be accepted to which I would finally click on the box "Finish" & my account would be added. Instead, I now get an error message in a yellow box stating "Unable to log in at srver. Probably wrong configuration, username or password" ? These are 2 new Hotmail accounts I have only JUST set-up. The details entered are all correct & log me into Outlook with no problems & work perfectly sending & receiving. As for "Configuration" I just let Thunderbird set the POP3 settings as done with the 2 old/existing Hotmail accounts which go in perfectly through Thunderbird. Is there something causing this with new hotmail accounts ?

Kind Regards

Geoff

content:
I've had this problem for a while on two computers, and through a few versions. I have also created a new profile on one (as the old profile was for some reason locking up every time I used it, and thankfully I use IMAP, so it was easy to recreate).

I thought I'd ask here before looking into raising a bug report.

title: Problem with Thunderbird/VPN
creator: T-bird1539
content:
Using Nord VPN: All Gmail accounts are set up for imap on Thunderbird:

1) With VPN on, I cannot send/receive emails from/to my Gmail accounts using Thunderbird. 2) With VPN off, I can send/receive emails from/to my Gmail accounts 3) With VPN on or off and logged directly on mail.google.com, I am able to send/receive emails

And, yes, I have tried different port numbers and all server info is correct for imap on Thunderbird as indicated by #2 above. This change happened overnight and Thunderbird always worked faultlessly with Nord VPN for years. I don't think we can blame Nord VPN for this, given #3 above.

Your thoughts?

title: archives folders
creator: cfogri1
content:
Hello thunderbird support team, Maybe someone can direct me to how fix an issue to create backup my emails and only have my inbox and sent email of this year. (2025) I don't know if I am doing something wrong or is this a thunderbird bug report?

I am using AOL, as my email provider. Goal is the create a folder of each year with all the emails received and sent that year into an archive folder. How I preform this task. 1. I create folders with thunderbird, these folders are then pushed into my AOL email account called archive folders. (works fine) 2. I move (highlight and drag) my inbox emails into a folder by a year, which removes them from my inbox, and this puts a copy of each email into the archive folder that I dragged them too. (works fine) 3. I do the same function (highlight and drag) my sent emails as I did in step 2 above. (deletes all the emails, that were in that folder that were inbox emails (received emails) that I wanted to save.

Here is the question. Why would moving my sent emails to the same archive folder, delete my saved INBOX EMAILS in that were in the archive folder? I lose completely and can't find them, not in trash, only the Sent emails are left in the file after 3 above is performed.

I would have thought that both the inbox (received emails) and sent emails would coexist in the same file! With maybe the sent arrow to identify the sent emails from the inbox emails. I tested this a few times with small batches of emails and each time I lost the inbox email in the Archive folder.

When I created the Archive subfolder for 2023 Sent year see below, (photo) to store my sent emails, nothing we deleted in my 2023 Archived inbox saved emails. Conclusion: for some reason, both Received INBOX and SENT emails can not be combined in one Archive folder? Really? Regards Eric S

title: Tiny Text in opened message windows...
creator: AlexanderCarpenter
content:
Whenever I open a message from the inbox into its own window, the message text and images are tiny and unreadable until I zoom (Shift-Cmd-+) them larger. And when I reply to a message, the text is also starts out tiny, but gets larger when I Zoom it up with the original message. Similarly, the column-header icons of the inbox are tiny, while the text is OK.

All the rest of the interface is normal and readable, except for the tiny text and buttons in the interface-command/confirmation boxes.

I have experimented with the suggestions in these question-replies, but to no avail:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1474665

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1480963

I can adjust the font size and density from the "hamburger menu", just fine. And the MacOS 15.3.n-on-Intel settings seem right.

What am I missing? What else is there to change?

Thanks in advance... Alexander, long-time T'bird user

title: thunderbird cannot connect with Ieee.org
creator: tgchristopher
content: I have been using Thunderbird for my e mail for decades, and always with the IEEE email service as the address. As a result my address on IEEE.org has been my standard identity for at least 30 years, and Thunderbird has been my means of communication with it. However the IEEE has now removed Mozilla and Thunderbird as a means of communication with the e mails arriving on their website. It is now necessary to use a google controlled app which is unfamiliar to me, does not provide service to my personal machine and seems to sort through and remove contacts without asking. Complaining to IEEE seems to be pointless. I personally do not like to have all my contacts and private data passing through Google as it seems intrusive and tries to control every aspect of my internet contact including my cell phone. I understand that this action of IEEE is against all e mail programs other than gmail which is actually running their site I do not know how to extricate myself from the IEEE server while maintaining all of my previous contacts. I thought I should write to outline the problem I am facing and to ask where I can find a reliable e mail server after this debacle. Any suggestions would be appreciated
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:135.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/135.0
